page.title: 13SLAWIT MOONRAKERS.
page.content: Smuggling was quite commonplace in the early 19th. Century,and in those days,the canal which ran through the centre of Slaithwaite Village was very busy with barges and trading boats. The wharf would be full of boats loading and unloading their merchandise. So it was very probable that on a dark night smuggled casks of Brandy or Rum were dumped into the canal to be recovered at a later date The story goes that some of the smugglers were caught by the customs men in the act of raking the canal to find the contraband, they pretended to be either dim-witted or drunk and said they were raking that cheese out of the canal.The cheese being the reflection of the full moon on the water.Hence-Slawit Moonrakers. {S.M.Thomas.B.A.
